title: Very Spacious 2 bed 2 Bath in Very Walkable Location!
posting_body: Take a video tour of apartment 628 here: https://youtu.be/X_JTXT3YJJc
AVA is a new living space steps from the energy of Ballard – where bars and clubs converge with galleries and restaurants, where sushi meets tacos, and music collides with performing arts.
Oh yeah, and just blocks from the 44, 17 and Rapid Ride D bus lines, we're a straight shot to Downtown Seattle.
From True North Roasting House and Great Notion Brewing to Ballard Corners Park and Majestic Bay Theatres, there will always be opportunities to have unique experiences.
Our chic studios and 1- and 2-bedroom Seattle apartments feature an urban-inspired design that extends beyond your walls to social spaces to connect, relax and play.

There are chill spaces with Wi-Fi, flat screens and comfy seating to hang with your friends or unwind alone, an awesome fitness center, a pet run for your pooch, and lots of resident parking and bike storage.
And did we mention the Rooftop deck?
AVA Ballard.
Now with our Furnished+ program, apartment living is easier than ever before.
Appreciate the stylish furnishings and enjoy the convenience of pre-installed Wi-Fi and cable TV, flexible lease-terms, and utilities that are included in your rent.
With Furnished+, you can step right into the life you want to live, without all the hassle.

Ballard Apartments by Avalon Not only do we have an in-demand location, but our Seattle apartments have the latest features and amenities and are just steps from the best local hotspots, including the True North Roasting House, Great Notion Brewing, Ballard Corners Park and Majestic Bay Theatres.
Stroll around Seattle and discover what's in store for you.
Ballard Apartment Community Being part of AVA Ballard means you get more time to enjoying your life and less time worrying about apartment maintenance and upkeep.
So what are you waiting for?
Dive in and make our Seattle apartments your new home today.
Apartment homes include features for persons with disabilities required by the Federal Fair Housing Act.
